heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 08 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (193°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.7°C), outside temperature (down 9.4°C), and inside temperature (down 3.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 399 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in outside temperature (up 10.8°C), cloud levels (up 380 m), and inside temperature (up 4.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 398.9m lower than yesterday, 266.6m lower than the past week, 379.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 993m to a maximum of 2630m, averaging 1223.6m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1490.2m and 1603.5m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; subzero temperatures are forecasted. Also, winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dark. Stable weather patterns due to high pressure.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (1.0°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
